meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound.
meanings.sent1: The old door would jarp loudly whenever it was opened.
meanings.sent2: I heard the metal gate jarp shut behind me.
meanings.sent3: The rusty hinges continued to jarp, causing a funny rhythm in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The car's brakes suddenly jarped, startling everyone inside.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm made the windows jarp with its powerful winds.

meanings.sent1: The jarp of the chainsaw echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The jarp of the metal scraping against the floor was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The jarp of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The jarp of the brakes screeched through the silent night.
meanings.sent5: The jarp of the thunder made the ground tremble.

meanings.definition: To move with a harsh, grating sound.
meanings.sent1: The heavy cart would jarp along the uneven road.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden chair jarped as he shifted his weight.
meanings.sent3: The rusty wheels continued to jarp as the cart moved slowly.
meanings.sent4: The train started to jarp as it picked up speed.
meanings.sent5: The old swing set would jarp with each push.
